title: installation after unintentionally uninstalling thunderbird
content:
I recently upgraded my computer to add storage -- Thunderbird had been warning me for about two weeks that my storage was full and needed attention. The backstory is that about three months ago my email suddenly went from archived to my active email file as being unread and available to review. It was difficult to work around at first but that is what I have done...just worked around it. About one week ago I lost access to my Thunderbird emails. I had been working to remove files from my hard drive to free up storage space. [in the end I obtained additional storage capacity] and may have inadvertently deleted Thunderbird.

Currently: I began to reinstall thunderbird. The "Account Set Up" icon it asks for credentials--I had to create a new password (which could be the problem). The next question is for me to choose IMAP or POP3; selected POP3. I get the message "available configuration" but then when it is done searching I get an error message that says it cannot login to server and "can't login to server "possibly wrong configuration, username or password." I do not know how to get this straightened out. Any suggestions are appreciated.
creator: walkingpearl2

title: Unable to (re) configure server
content:
I have an existing account (email name) that is being moved to a different server.

The new server uses a different security setting and also needs a different user name in the account settings field.

However, I can't change more than one of these things at a time because with each value added to a field, thunderbird insists on a restart, so I can never enter a consistent set. Each time, Thunderbird detects that the settings don't work and resets everything.

I tried making another account, but after working for a while that seems to have evaporated on me.

In the meantime, I'm not able to get to my mail.
creator: asmusf

title: Default Email in From field - Can't find setting to get rid of it
content:
I have several emails. I've been noticing that some of my emails are going out with a "default" email. (I just saw this stated, but I can't find it again.) I never set a default email.

This does NOT happen when I reply to someone, only when I start a new email.

I went to each of the account settings and checked the box which says FROM address, and entered the correct address for each. It continues to use the Default reply email.

I found on this site a couple of old messages regarding this issue. A couple of replies said this will happen if the SMTP doesn't differentiate. With my service, it's the same SMTP for all the accounts - smtpauth.earthlink.net. The wanted reply email is in the User Name box in that dialog box.

Is there a way to tell Thunderbird to either NOT use a default email?
creator: KJS-LES

title: Double counting of new e-mails on Thunderbird icon.
content:
Hi.  :-) For quite a long time now, I have seen this error (that was not before in some instance): When I receive an e-mail the program is setup to give a notification that there is a new e-mail, plus on the Thunderbird icon in the taskbar (is that the name for it), there is a continuous count of unread messages. So far so good. But then if you don't read the message(s) right away, after a little time the notification (for the same e-mail(s)) comes again and the count of unread e-mails goes up - even though there is no new e-mails other then the one(s) that came before.

So if you leave the computer unatended for some time and you come back, the Thunderbird icon says that you have 40 unread messages (for example) and you think "oh no, so many" - but when you open the e-mail program, there is only half of that. See attached images. This test I made by sending e-mails to my self. My e-mail is setup to receive e-mails every 5 minutes and I think the second notification and count-up might come at that 5 minute point - when it is time for the software to look for new messages.

It only does this with the main e-mail account. I also have the e-mail program setup to receive e-mails from another e-mail adress - but this count stays true on the Thunderbird icon and does not give extra notification and double count of unread messages.

How to fix that - or is it a general issue that needs to be fixed in the Thunderbird code? It have been like this for a quite long time, but I have not known how / where to ask about it.

Kind regards Master of Science in Engineering Thorvald Johannes Pedersen Denmark
creator: tjp25

title: Thunderbird freezes when saving attachments using "Save All" on Windows 10
content:
Thunderbird versions: 128 esr and 131 (both exhibit this problem). OS: Windows 10.

Issue: Thunderbird freezes when trying to save all attachments. This occurs when using "Save All". The dialog box to select the folder appears and then Thunderbird stops responding. "Not Responding" appears in the dialog box title. Windows then pops up a dialog offering to close the program or wait for it to respond (which it never does). No crash report is generated.

Note: 1. This issue does not occur when using "Save As..." and saving the attachments individually. 2. This does not occur when dragging attachments (all, or individually) to the Desktop or to other folders 3. This seems to occur independent of the types of the attachments.

Is this a bug or is there a way to fix this?

title: Thunderbird nebula windows 10 corrupts PDF files - Outlook.com account - additional information
content:
I found an interim solution to the problem of the corrupted PDF files by Thunderbird Nebula, as follows:

take Thunderbird offline - move the email with the corrupted PDF attachment to Outlook Archive folder - put Thunderbird back in the online modus - move email from the Archive folder to the Incoming Post folder

title: I followed these directions but in "Roaming"!  What do I do now?
content:
I Menu app icon > Help > More Troubleshooting Information 

   Under 'Application Basics' - Profile Folder - click on 'Open Folder'

This opens a new window showing the contents of your current in use profile name folder. 

   Exit Thunderbird now - this is important.

Look for the following files and delete them. 

   cert8.db - obselete file    cert9.db - currently used file    key3.db - obselete file    key4.db - current used file    logins.json - current used file    pkcs11.txt (some people report this file missing)    secmod.db - obselete file    session.json    xulstore.json

See next comment before you start Thunderbird as you need to empty cache files.

Start Thunderbird

Add yahoo and make sure all the settings are correct. Make sure Authentication Method is Oauth and user name is full yahoo email address.

Report on results.

Modified 15 zuwɛn 2022 23:27:52 -0700 by Toad-Hall Toad-Hall Toad-Hall 

   Top 10 Contributor

15/6/2022 23:26 Chosen Solution

ADDITIONAL Whilst Thunderbird is closed - after you have deleted the files mentioned previously.

access : C:/Users/ User Account/Appdata/Local/Thunderbird/Profiles/ Please note this is the Appdata 'Local' location which the computer uses as a cache. Be sure you are in the 'Local' and not the 'Roaming' Delete the contents of the 'Profiles' folder.

then start Thunderbird. keep having to reset my secure key password and tried this in "Roaming" instead of "Local" Help!

title: Download Older Thunderbird Messages from Copied Folder
content:
Hi, Thunderbirders -

Regarding the recent HostGator foreign-based DOS attack problem that resulted in having all my messages prior to 10/04/2024 wiped from my host account, I was able to download the entire Thunderbird folder, containing all these previous messages, from my office PC which was not online at the time of the incident, and which I have deliberately kept offline since:

C:\Users\User\Appdata\Roaming\THUNDERBIRD

Now I need the procedure to locate the older messages wherever they are stored in this folder and successfully download them (from 2017, so may have to do this in batches) into the current version running on my laptop, before I again attempt to login to Thunderbird from the office PC. Any step-by-step instructions would be greatly appreciated, and thanks again for all your suggestions so far.

FYI, the app itself is not infected with any virus - the messages were erased as part of the HostGator reinstall process, not a ransomware attack.

- Arthur

title: Account keeps prompting re IMAP auth failure, but all server settings are set to NOT poll
content:
A google workspace account I used to use has been deleted on google. I want to keep my repository of emails for that account. I have tried to tell tbird NOT to poll any servers re this account, but I think it still does.

For that account in server settings: - check for new messages at startup is off - check for new messages every x minutes is off - allow immediate server notifications when new messages arrive is off

I remove the SMTP setting for that account entirely.

The error message mostly shows up when I've switched from say Sent to Inbox. At those times I am not even looking at that accounts messages, there are other active accounts. The exact message is: Authentication failure when connecting to server imap.gmail.com I can't be positive that it is related to this now gone account that I still keep in thunderbird, but the issue did start when the account went inactive.
creator: sparrowtwo
